DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Nodal Status Classification Imaging Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The way clinical nodal status was determined

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part._A condition or state at a particular time._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005

Concepts.definition: An ultrasound administered by using a tube containing flexible fibre optic wires that allows for the analysis of tissues inside the body.  Ultrasound technology utilizes high frequency waves and their echoes to produce an image. 2005

PermissibleValues.value: MRI of the abdomen and pelvis AND [a chest x-ray (PA and lateral), or CT/combined PET/CT scan of the chest]
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: MRI of the abdomen and pelvis and a chest x-ray (PA and lateral), or CT/combined PET/CT scan of the chest

ValueMeaning.preferredName: MRI of the abdomen and pelvis and a chest x-ray (PA and lateral), or CT/combined PET/CT scan of the chest
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: MRI of the abdomen and pelvis and a chest x-ray (PA and lateral), or CT/combined PET/CT scan of the chest

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
